intro: Dampiera lindleyi, commonly known as the silverleaf damper, is a flowering plant native to Australia. It belongs to the family Boraginaceae and is characterized by its small, blue or purple flowers. The plant has a low, sprawling growth habit with hairy, silver-gray leaves that help reduce water loss in arid conditions.
